Fields.DialogueText: Attention! We have Morganas in sight! Prepare for combat!
@BATTLE
Another well-fought victory. Congratulations, everyone!
Thank you, Captain!
If it wasn't for you and Garibaldi, there was no way we could've won, Captain! Thank you!

Fields.MenuText: Garibaldi? Are you all right?
You're awfully quiet today.
Hello? Garibaldi? What are you staring at?

Fields.DialogueText: O-oh! Sorry, Capitano! I was lost in thought for a minute!
Whoops! I apologize! Congratulations, everyone! You never cease to amaze me!
N-nothing, Capitano! I was a bit tired after the battle!
Are you going to be okay? You do seem a bit off...
Sto bene! Thank you for showing your concern!
Thank you, ma'am!
I just... don't know what to do about her.
When was the last time you sent her a letter?
I sent her one when I was first stationed here...
What?! Why haven't you kept in touch?!

Fields.MenuText: I heard yelling. What's going on?
Is there a problem, Garibaldi?
Are you pestering the crew?

Fields.DialogueText: I apologize about the noise, but we have an issue regarding this sailor and his lover!
A problem of passion, Capitano. I'm trying to help our friend rekindle his romance!
When it comes to a serious issue such as love, I have to put my foot down!
Is there anything I can--
Allow me! Now, you need to send her a letter! She must be worried sick about you!
But if I--
No "ifs"! Send her a letter next time we refuel! You must keep your love strong! Don't lose the most important part of being human!
O-all right...
@BATTLE
Garibaldi, over here!
It may not be the best seating in the house, but at least you don't have to climb over anyone to put your tray down.
It's fine! I always love eating in the mess!

Fields.MenuText: It's nice to eat with the crew every now and then...
The noise is nice, but I usually prefer eating in my quarters.
What do you like about it?

Fields.DialogueText: I agree! It's fun listening to their stories!
Nothing beats having a meal with you, Capitano!
I just love seeing how happy they all are!
Capitano! You don't have any oranges on your plate!
Well, I thought I'd try something different.
You need your citrus! Here, have mine!
Ready? If you catch this orange slice, I'll carve you something!
Wait, Garibaldi. Just put--
Here it comes!
You... you caught it! Yay! Great catch, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Ciao, Capitano! Apologies for bothering you in your quarters, but do you have a moment?
Sure, what's on your mind?
Well, I was crafting some trinkets for the crew and I'm curious. Would you like to help me carve something special?

Fields.MenuText: Sure, but I don't have any stuff to work with though...
If it won't take too long, then I'll help.
Depends. What are you carving?

Fields.DialogueText: I got you covered, Capitano! Let's get started!
I promise it will be quick!
If I told you that, it wouldn't be a secret anymore!
*Some Time Later*
Done! You weren't too bad! Maybe we can do this more often?
I think I'd like that a lot. Anyway, who is this for?
Ohh... it's for you, Capitano!
You really are something special, Garibaldi...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Is that...?
Yes, definitely. Morganas ahead!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hummmm, hum hum hummmm...
You know, Garibaldi, I've only heard you hum that melody, I've never heard it anywhere else before.
Really, Capitano? How have you not heard it before?
We absolutely must find a record player and Bersaglieri's Fanfare along with it!
I'm not sure where we'd find one. Ideas?
Next time we resupply, we can ask around to see if they have a spare record player!

Fields.MenuText: I'll keep my eyes peeled. If I find something I'll let you know.
I can have one of the officers ask around.
If you hear anything, let me know.

Fields.DialogueText: Yay! I can't wait!
I'll let them know what to look for!
Will do!
The ship is ready for a replenishment at sea, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Excellent work, Officer. You're dismissed.
Before we begin, ask the folks on the other ship if they have a record player.
Garibaldi has a special request of you...

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain...
Will do, Captain.
I trust it won't be too out of the way...
If there's nothing else, I'll get to it.
I'll have Garibaldi go with you. Dismissed.
Captain, I think I can–
Yay! Anyway, I don't think we've ever had the chance to talk to one another yet.
I don't believe we have...
So... do you like carvings?
@BATTLE
Don't forget about a record player!
A record player? Planning on a party, ma'am?
Something like that!
C-capitano! *grunt* Little help with this record player, please!
Sure thing! Let's just set it on this table here.
Clearly, you finally tracked the player down.
I sure did!
How'd you come across it?
I guess the folks on the ship supplying us had a spare one! Anyway, they didn't have a record of Bersaglieri's Fanfare...

Fields.MenuText: I'll ask around to see if we can get our hands on it...
As much as I'd love to, we do have more pressing matters...
Just try to keep yourself focused on the war first.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't wait for you and the crew to hear it!
I know, Capitano. But I think that this will help boost sailor morale!
I'd never lose focus on the war, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Attention! Morganas have been sighted! Prepare for combat!
@BATTLE
Captain, we need to talk about the Belle.
Garibaldi? What's the issue?
It's about her and the crew...
I don't think there's any problem there, officer...
There is, Captain. She's been spoiling the crew ever since we took her in. Her giving them trinkets and patting them on the backs is softening them up horribly.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think it's been doing harm. You're imagining things.
I believe that you don't approve of her. You need to put any judgement of her behind you.
Don't get jealous. She's been a huge help. We need to work together.

Fields.DialogueText: Look, I know you two are close, but softening our crew won't help.
Can we really trust her? She is part of the Fasc--
I'm not jealous of the Belle, Captain.
I appreciate you speaking your mind, but I keep a close eye on crew fitness and crew readiness. By every metric we track, it's improving.
If you have a problem with our Belle, I don't think you've quite identified what it is.
Uh... but...
Think about it. But think somewhere else - you're dismissed.
Capitano! I found it!
You're awfully excited! What did you find?
A record of Bersaglieri's Fanfare! Finally!
And I get the first listen? I'm flattered, Garibaldi!
Well... you deserve it, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: So, do people dance to this music?
I'm excited to see your reaction to it as well. It must've been a while since you've heard it.
I'm ready to hear it, Garibaldi!

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... I think so...
I can't wait! Let's see how well it holds up!
Then here we go!
I hate to interrupt, Captain. But we need you on the bridge.
Aww! Promise you'll listen next time?
I promise.
@BATTLE
Capitano! I brought some food for us! How about a break?
Orange slices and coffee again?
You guessed it!
Sounds good! It's been a bit since we had a break together. Have a seat.
I was thinking that we could play Bersaglieri's Fanfare while we eat.
Sure. I don't think we can expect any more interruptions...
Yay! Now get ready to experience some beautiful music!
Listen... (plays the record)
It sounds just as mesmerizing as I remember! What did you think of it, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: Incredible! I love it!
I can see why you hum it so much...
Will the crew hear this?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm so glad!
Isn't it catchy? It always sounded so full of energy to me!
I hope so! With your permission, of course!
Even without the music, private time with you is something I'll always enjoy.
@BATTLE
Agreed...
It's normal for two people to hold hands while they listen to Bersaglieri's Fanfare records, right?
Mmm... I'm enjoying it.
*ALARM*
*sigh* Come on, Capitano! Let's go...
Look, I know you mean well, but you cannot distract the crew with such things.
It's helping them! All we do is fight, so everyone needs a break now and again!
What seems to be the problem?
Captain, she wants to make room in the cafeteria for the record player and throw a party!
It's not really a party! We could just lay out some good food and drinks with some nice background music, and the crew could take a breather from all this fighting!

Fields.MenuText: That actually sounds like a party... but it seems fine to me.
I don't see the harm in it. Go ahead, Garibaldi!
As long as I get an invite and a dance with Garibaldi, then host this!

Fields.DialogueText: But, Captain!
But, Captain!
But, Captain!
I have to put my foot down, Captain–
*ALARM*
Look, we have the supplies, it doesn't sound disruptive, and it gives the crew something to look forward to.
It's going to happen.
Now, let's get to the bridge.
@BATTLE
Yay! I promise that it'll be a small get together!
This is really important to the crew, Capitano. Thank you!
A dance? I-I guess a dance wouldn't hurt. I'd have to learn how to...
Like this, Capitano! You just put the entire orange half in your mouth.
Excuse me, ma'am?
Oh, I recognize you! We talked about sending a letter to your lady back home!
That's right! Mind if I sit down?
Go right ahead!
So...how did it go?
Well, she was mad at me...but I told her my situation and she understood.
A while back when we chatted, I made this. Mail it to her as a gift.
A heart? Did you carve this?
I did, now hurry and think of a romantic thing to add to it!
I will! Thank you, ma'am!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: ... advice on love?
... of an effect on me? Just looking at you makes me smile.
... time to carve things for people?

Fields.DialogueText: Ah! Hello, Capitano!
I'm amazed, Garibaldi. How do you have so much...
Free time on a ship can be easy to find if you look. I'm also really fast at carving, you know.
My heart just understands it, Capitano.
You charmer! Having you around makes me feel good, too.
*ALARM*
Capitano! Think we have time for another carving lesson?
I think we do. Come on in, Garibaldi.
Great! Let's get started!
*Some Time Later*
And just one last--
Ow!
What happened?! Capitano, your finger is bleeding!

Fields.MenuText: It's nothing, Garibaldi. I have some iodine and bandages in here.
It doesn't look too bad. I just need more practice.
How does it look?

Fields.DialogueText: Nonsense! You're bleeding. Let me take care of you, Capitano.
C-Capitano! Oh, this is my fault. Let me help with that...
Looks like you're bleeding, Capitano! Here, hold out your finger and I'll take care of it.
Aaaand... there. Now you're all fixed up.
Garibaldi, are you blushing?
I-uh... I'm gonna go check on the crew... if you need any help, come and find me, Capitano...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I just want the crew to be happy... and they deserve it!
Look, I do appreciate everything you've done for us, ma'am - but you understand that we're at war.
I know we are, Officer. But war isn't just about winning every battle. We need to stay in high spirits.
You think a dance with the captain is going to raise morale? With you blushing? I think maybe what you really want is--
N-no! It's about letting the crew have moments to rest!
Before I attend a more pressing matter, let me give you some advice
What are you two doing in here?
Hello, Captain. Ah.... I'll be going now...

Fields.MenuText: He's still giving you a hard time?
I can talk to him...
Arguing about the party still?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah... I tried to apologize...
No, I think it's best that I handle this.
Something like that...
Forget it for now. This is ridiculous. Let's head to the bridge, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Garibaldi?
Is that you I hear humming?
Eek! Don't scare me like that, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: What are you doing in my quarters?
Carving something?
Slacking off?

Fields.DialogueText: J-just working on something for the party!
Maybe... it's a secret.
Never!
You've had some tough days lately. I brought you something...
Coffee?! How sweet of you, Capitano!
So why are you carving here? Don't you usually do it near sick bay?
Usually I do, but it was getting a bit loud lately. I thought I'd make myself at home in your quarters, Capitano...
That's fine by me. You're always welcome here!
You're too kind to me! Well, I gotta find someplace else to finish this... and thank you for the coffee!
@BATTLE
How do you deal with it?
With what?
Love.
Love? Um... Usually, I-and...

Fields.MenuText: Are you all right, Garibaldi?
You're blushing.
I've never seen you this flustered before.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I am!
No, I'm not! Am I blushing?
It's just, I wasn't expecting that!
Well, with love I usually make something...
Like, a gift?
Right! I make them something special! It shows how much you mean to them...
Well, that's a good piece of advice. Next time we resupply, I'll get something for my wife...
@BATTLE
You're bright red, ma'am...
*ALARM*
How's your carving going, Garibaldi?
Fine...
Anything on your mind?
I've been thinking...
About?
A while back you said you'd like to tour Italy with me.
I still would love to.
And I'm trying to think of where we should start when the war is over.

Fields.MenuText: We could go to a café and chat about politics.
I figured we could check out some tourist attractions. Maybe a market or two.
Location doesn't matter. I'll probably be looking at you most of the time.

Fields.DialogueText: You know me so well, Capitano!
There are a lot of beautiful sights to see. We'd never get bored.
(blushes) O-oh! ... That's incredibly sweet of y-you...
*ALARM*
Cattive Ragazze have awful timing...
Quick, let's get to our positions!
Will do!
@BATTLE
I've got it!
What have you got?
I know how to make the officer like me!
The one that argued about the party?
I realized that I never made him anything! No candles, carvings, nothing!

Fields.MenuText: Garibaldi, I think it's best to just leave him alone.
That might help, but don't get too fixated on this.
He's not the type that likes gifts. Is he?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sorry, Capitano. But I can't. Especially now.
I won't, I promise!
Nonsense! Everyone likes gifts!
Next time I see him, I'll give him a candle! I know he's a reader!
If you say so...
Also, promise you'll help me set the mess hall soon?
Sure thing.
@BATTLE
Where are we going, Garibaldi?
We're going to visit the officer that doesn't like me!
That doesn't explain why you're taking me with you.
I need you to be my backup in case things go south, all right?
All right...
Garibaldi. Captain. What do you need?
Look, I know we don't get along well, so I thought I'd make you this. The capitano said you enjoyed reading.
A candle?

Fields.MenuText: To help read at night. Please accept it.
We have to work together against the Morganas... so... do we have a truce?
She wants to make amends.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you...
Truce.
I guess a party wouldn't hurt...
It's all right! And let's make sure we always fight well together, too.
I'm sorry, Garibaldi, if I haven't been friendly to you. I'll be better about that going forward.
@BATTLE
We are approaching a Morgana-infested zone! Be on high alert, and give them hell!
@BATTLE
Now that we've dealt with the Morganas in the vicinity, I have an announcement!
What is it, ma'am?
The Capitano and I have been planning on this for a while.
We'd like to thank all of you for your dedication to the war effort.
We've decided that to host a little party for all of us on the mess decks.
Really? Thank you, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Don't thank me, it was Garibaldi's idea.
Now a few ground rules.
Again, consider it a thank you for your hard work!

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, ma'am!
Ground rules? What ground rules?
Thank you, Captain!
Now, we still have preparations to make, so keeping going strong!
Yes, ma'am!
I can't wait!
Have fun!
Yay!
Oh, Capitano! Know what time it is?
Another carving lesson?
You bet! What are we gonna make?

Fields.MenuText: How about a heart?
A rose.
What would you like to make?

Fields.DialogueText: *blush* That sounds nice...
*blush* Very romantic, Capitano...
*blush* How about a heart?
Let's begin!
Just show me what to do...
*SOME TIME LATER*
Wow, you've definitely improved, Capitano!
It seems that way... and here. I want you to have it. Consider it a thank you for being an amazing teammate.
*blush* Just a teammate? Really?
Haha! Garibaldi, just look at the gift and you'll understand what I mean.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Here, let me guide your hands a little bit...
Come a little closer so I can see...
Hey, this isn't that bad!
I know! It's pretty catchy!
I'm glad both of you like it! That's what we're going to listen to during the party!
What does the Captain think?
The Capitano loves it! Anyway, I gotta get some more things to help prepare for the party!
Eek!
Woah! That was quite the trip, Garibaldi.
But you caught me!

Fields.MenuText: Need help, madame?
(Hold her closely for a long moment)
Good thing I showed up...

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Quite the chivalrous one, aren't you?
It's a good thing you did!
Anyway... I gotta prepare for the party... See you around, Capitano!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Let's take care of this little preparation, too.
I think it looks good, Captain!
Not too formal?
I think it'll be fine.

Fields.MenuText: Where's Garibaldi?
Think Garibaldi will like it?
You excited for the party?

Fields.DialogueText: Fixing up the mess decks, last time I saw.
I think she will!
Of course, Captain!
You know, I'm glad Garibaldi is with us...
How so?
She's been incredible at keeping our spirits high.
She has. I can't imagine fighting the Morganas without her...
Same here...
@BATTLE
Is that Bersaglieri's Fanfare I hear?
Capitano?
Wow...you look great!

Fields.MenuText: You look great yourself, Garibaldi!
Everyone having fun?
Are you enjoying yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: *blush* Grazie, Capitano!
Absolutely! They love the music!
Now that you're here, I am!
Now, that we have some music, how about a dance?
I'd love to. Take me out, Capitano!
Oh! You know how to dance!
Impressed?
I am...
You look awfully cute today...
*blush* C-Capitano...
*ALARM*
We'll finish this later? Please?
@BATTLE
Garibaldi? I heard you humming.
Capitano.
I believe I owe you a dance...
*blush* You do... What a shame that the party on the mess decks is all wrapped up now.
And the record player?
I like it better when you hum it to me.
Really?
Really. It's cute...
I'm glad to be with you, Capitano.
I am too...

Fields.MenuText: We have enough room in here for the two of us to dance.
Let's stay here.
You're officially invited to my after-party.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not leaving.
I hope nobody else gets invited.
A cozy fit. I love it.
